Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lake Charles Prop. No. 1 -- 2.31 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Lake Charles Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lake Charles, Louisiana (the "City") continue to levy and collect a tax not to exceed 2.31 mills in any year on all property subject to taxation within the City for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2017, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $1,470,122 for one entire year, for maintenance of public buildings, streets and bridges in the City?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lake Charles Prop. No. 2 -- 1.70 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Lake Charles Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lake Charles, Louisiana (the "City") continue to levy and collect a tax not to exceed 1.70 mills in any year on all property subject to taxation within the City for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2017, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $1,081,908 for one entire year, for the purpose of maintenance of playgrounds and recreation centers and equipment thereof?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lake Charles Prop. No. 3 -- 5.27 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Lake Charles Propositions
Proposition No. 3
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lake Charles, Louisiana (the "City") continue to levy and collect a tax not to exceed 5.27 mills in any year on all property subject to taxation within the City for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2017, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $3,353,915 for one entire year, for the purposes of maintaining pay increases and starting salaries previously authorized for employees of the Police, Fire, Public Works, and other departments of the City, and for maintenance of a police three platoon system?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lake Charles (Sales Tax Renewal) -- 1% S&U Tax - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Lake Charles Proposition
(Sales Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lake Charles, Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such renewal, a tax of one percent (1%) ("Tax"), with annual Tax collections estimated to be $24,000,000, upon sale at retail, use, lease or rental, consumption and storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property, and sale of services as defined in La. R.S. 47:301, et seq., for a period of ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2017, with Tax proceeds dedicated to construction, maintenance and repair of public buildings, roads, sidewalks, servitudes, highways, bridges, drainage, cutting grass, removing and collecting debris, limbs, trash and disposing thereof, and other public improvements to encourage industrial and economic development; public safety, fire and police protection; sewerage facilities and systems; and public parks and recreation facilities?
